summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Lieutenant's Log and Activity Report for August 9, 2019. It details routine operations, inmate counts, staff assignments, and security checks. The log notes several inmates on suicide watch, one inmate placed in a dry cell, and a treaty transfer that was canceled due to mechanical problems.

persons.name: R. Silvia
persons.context: Acting Lieutenant who signed off on the final Evening Watch shift log entry, recording the ending inmate counts and statuses.

persons.name: GARC/A-PENA
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 79043-054 who was placed in Administrative Detention at 9:29 PM on August 9, 2019, for an unspecified reason.

events.title: Daily Operations at MCC New York
events.description: Routine daily operations including inmate counts, security checks, body alarm tests, and staff shift changes. Notable incidents include inmates on suicide watch, an inmate placed in a dry cell, and a canceled treaty transfer.

events.title: Inmate Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: Inmate GARC/A-PENA (Reg #79043-054) was placed in Administrative Detention at 9:29 PM.

events.title: Treaty Transfer Canceled
events.description: A treaty transfer return was noted as canceled ('Flight Can-x') due to mechanical problems.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a detailed operational log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 9, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.
It records multiple inmates on suicide watch with inmate companions and one inmate placed in a dry cell under staff watch.
A treaty transfer (potentially for an inmate) was canceled due to mechanical problems with a flight.
The log shows routine security procedures were being followed, including body alarm tests, inmate counts, and equipment checks.
The Control Center Fire Panel was reported as inoperative, and there were staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments.
